column3: description

[Internally displaced children](#dod:internally-displaced) under 18 years old, who had to leave their homes due to conflict and violence but remain within their country's borders. This counts all children who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.

[Internally displaced children](#dod:internally-displaced) under 18 years old, who had to leave their homes due to disasters but remain within their country's borders. This counts all children who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.

Total [internally displaced children](#dod:internally-displaced) under 18 years old, who were forced or obliged to leave their homes but remain within their country's borders. This counts all children who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.
Total number of children under 18 years old who live in this country but were born in another country.

New [internal displacements](#dod:displacements) of children under 18 years old, due to conflict and violence. Internal displacement describes the movement of a child who is forced to leave their home due to conflict and violence but who remains within their country's borders. One child can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in this data.

New [internal displacements](#dod:displacements) of children under 18 years old, due to disasters. Internal displacement describes the movement of a child who is forced to leave their home due to disasters but who remains within their country's borders. One child can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in this data.

Total number of new [internal displacements](#dod:displacements) of children under 18 years old. Internal displacement describes the movement of a child who is forced to leave their home but who remains within their country's borders. One child can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in this data.

Number of children under 18 years old who are [refugees](#dod:refugee) by the country of asylum. This number describes all refugees who are currently living in the asylum country, not only refugees arriving in this year.

Number of children under 18 years old who are [refugees](#dod:refugee) by their country of origin. This number describes all refugees who have left their origin country, not only refugees leaving in this year.

Number of children under 18 years old who are [refugees](#dod:refugee) per 1000 inhabitants of the asylum country. This number describes all refugees who are currently living in the asylum country, not only refugees arriving in this year.

Number of children under 18 years old who are [refugees](#dod:refugee) per 1000 inhabitants of the origin country. This number describes all refugees who have left their origin country, not only refugees leaving in this year.
Total number of children under 18 years old who live in this country but were born in another country, per 1000 inhabitants of the destination country.

[Internally displaced children](#dod:internally-displaced) under 18 years old, who were forced or obliged to leave their homes but remain within their country's borders, per 1000 inhabitants of the country. This counts all children who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.

New [internally displacements](#dod:displacements) of children under 18 years old, per 1000 inhabitants of the country. Internal displacement describes the movement of a child who is forced to leave their home but who remains within their country's borders. One child can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in this data.

[Internally displaced children](#dod:internally-displaced) under 18 years old, who had to leave their homes due to conflict and violence but remain within their country's borders, per 1000 inhabitants of the country. This counts all children who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.

[Internally displaced children](#dod:internally-displaced) under 18 years old, who had to leave their homes due to disasters but remain within their country's borders, per 1000 inhabitants of the country. This counts all children who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.

New [internal displacements](#dod:displacements) of children under 18 years old due to conflict and violence per 1000 inhabitants of the country. Internal displacement describes the movement of a child who is forced to leave their home due to conflict and violence but who remains within their country's borders. One child can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in this data.

New [internal displacements](#dod:displacements) of children under 18 years old due to disasters per 1000 inhabitants of the country. Internal displacement describes the movement of a child who is forced to leave their home due to disaster but who remains within their country's borders. One child can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in this data.
Total number of cross-border [refugees](#dod:refugee) by their country of origin. This includes all refugees from this country, not just the people who left their origin country this year.

Total number of [asylum seekers](#dod:asylumseeker), so people who have a pending application for asylum or refugee status in any country, by the country of origin. This includes all asylum seekers from this country, not just the new asylum seekers this year.
Total number of cross-border [refugees](#dod:refugee) by the country they live in. This includes all refugees living in this country, not just the new refugees arriving this year.

[Asylum seekers](#dod:asylumseeker) are people whose application for asylum or refugee status is pending at any stage in the asylum procedure. This includes all asylum seekers living in this country, not just the new asylum seekers arriving this year.
Total number of [stateless persons](#dod:stateless) by the country they live in.
Returned cross-border [refugees](#dod:refugee) by the country of origin and return. Only refugees who returned during the calendar year are included.
[Internally displaced people (IDPs)](#dod:internally-displaced) who returned to their home (region) by the country of origin. Only IDPs who returned during the calendar year are included.

Newly [resettled refugees](#dod:resettlement) by the country of origin, which is the country the refugee originally fled from. Resettlement enables refugees to relocate to another country which has agreed to admit them with a legal status ensuring international protection and ultimately permanent residence.
Returned [refugees](#dod:refugee) by the country they lived in before their return. Only refugees who returned during the calendar year are included.

Newly [resettled refugees](#dod:resettlement) by the country they resettle in. Resettlement enables refugees to relocate to another country which has agreed to admit them with a legal status ensuring international protection and ultimately permanent residence.

Number of cross-border [refugees](#dod:refugee) by country of origin, per 1,000 people in that country. This includes all refugees from this country, not just the people who left their origin country this year.
Cross-border [refugees](#dod:refugee) by the country they live in, per 1,000 people in that country. This includes all refugees living in this country, not just the new refugees arriving this year.
Number of [asylum seekers](#dod:asylumseeker) per 100,000 people in the country of origin. This includes all asylum seekers from this country, not just the new asylum seekers this year.

[Asylum seekers](#dod:asylumseeker) are people whose application for asylum or refugee status is pending at any stage in the asylum procedure. This measures total asylumn seekers per 100,000 people in that country.

Newly [resettled refugees](#dod:resettlement) by country of origin, per 100,000 people living in the country of origin. Resettlement enables refugees to relocate to another country which has agreed to admit them with a legal status ensuring international protection and ultimately permanent residence.

Newly [resettled refugees](#dod:resettlement) in this country, per 100,000 people living in the country of settlement. Resettlement enables refugees to relocate to another country which has agreed to admit them with a legal status ensuring international protection and ultimately permanent residence.

[Internally displaced people (IDPs)](#dod:internally-displaced) who returned to their home (region), per 1,000 inhabitants of the country of origin. Only IDPs who returned during the calendar year are included.
[Stateless persons](#dod:stateless), per 100,000 inhabitants of the country they live in.
People living in a given country who were born in another country.
People that were born in a country but now live in another country.
Share of GDP that is made up of the sum of all personal [remittances](#dod:remittances) sent by migrants to their home countries.
The average [transaction cost](#dod:remittancecost) as a percentage of total [remittance](#dod:remittances) sent from abroad to this country. The cost is based on a single transaction of USD 200.
The average [transaction cost](#dod:remittancecost) as a percentage of total [remittance](#dod:remittances) received from abroad. The cost is based on a single transaction of USD 200.

[Internally displaced people](#dod:internally-displaced) had to leave their homes due to conflict and violence and have not crossed an international state border. This counts all individuals who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced

[Internal displacement](#dod:displacements) describes the movement of a person who is forced to leave their home due to conflict and violence but who remains within their country's borders. One person can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in the data.

[Internal displacement](#dod:displacements) describes the movement of a person who is forced to leave their home due to [disaster](#dod:idmc-disaster) but who remains within their country's borders. One person can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in the data.

[Internally displaced people](#dod:internally-displaced) had to leave their homes due to [disasters](#dod:idmc-disaster) and have not crossed an international state border. This counts all individuals who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced

[Internally displaced people](#dod:internally-displaced) had to leave their homes because of violence or [disaster](#dod:idmc-disaster) and have not crossed an international state border. This counts all individuals who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.

[Internal displacements](#dod:displacements) due to both conflict and violence and [disaster](#dod:idmc-disaster). Internal displacement describes the movement of a person who is forced to leave their home but who remains within their country's borders. One person can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in the data.

[Internally displaced people](#dod:internally-displaced) had to leave their homes because of violence or [disaster](#dod:idmc-disaster) and have not crossed an international state border. This counts all individuals who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced.

[Internally displaced people](#dod:internally-displaced) had to leave their homes because of violence or [disaster](#dod:idmc-disaster) and have not crossed an international state border. This counts all individuals who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced

[Internally displaced people](#dod:internally-displaced) had to leave their homes due to [disasters](#dod:idmc-disaster) and have not crossed an international state border. This counts all individuals who are currently displaced, regardless of how many times they have been displaced

[Internal displacements](#dod:displacements) due to both conflict and [disaster](#dod:idmc-disaster), per 1000 people living in the country. Internal displacement describes the movement of a person who is forced to leave their home but who remains within their country's borders. One person can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in the data.

[Internal displacement](#dod:displacements) describes the movement of a person who is forced to leave their home due to conflict and violence but who remains within their country's borders. One person can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in the data.

[Internal displacement](#dod:displacements) describes the movement of a person who is forced to leave their home due to [disaster](#dod:idmc-disaster) but who remains within their country's borders. One person can be displaced multiple times within a calendar year and is then counted multiple times in the data.
